metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition
metadata.section_title: Dampproofing, Waterproofing and Soil Gas Control

requirements.description: This Section presents measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gases into buildings
requirements.exact_quote: This Section presents measures to control the ingress of water, moisture and soil gases into buildings

requirements.description: Subsection 9.13.2 applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are not subject to hydrostatic pressure
requirements.exact_quote: Subsection 9.13.2. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are not subject to hydrostatic pressure

requirements.description: Subsection 9.13.3 applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure
requirements.exact_quote: Subsection 9.13.3. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure

requirements.description: Subsection 9.13.4 applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground
requirements.exact_quote: Subsection 9.13.4. applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground

requirements.description: Where exterior finished ground level is higher than interior ground level, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed
requirements.exact_quote: where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed
conditions: exterior ground higher than interior ground level

requirements.description: Floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed
requirements.exact_quote: floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed

requirements.description: Dampproofing not required for floors in garages
requirements.exact_quote: floors in garages

requirements.description: Dampproofing not required for floors in unenclosed portions of buildings
requirements.exact_quote: floors in unenclosed portions of buildings

requirements.description: Dampproofing not required for floors installed over not less than 100mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4mm sieve
requirements.exact_quote: floors installed over not less than 100mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4mm sieve

requirements.description: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration
requirements.exact_quote: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected

requirements.description: Exterior dampproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D1227/D1227M, Type III, Class I
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D1227/D1227M, Standard Specification for Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing, Type III, Class I

requirements.description: Exterior dampproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D4479/D4479M, Type III
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D4479/D4479M, Standard Specification for Asphalt Roof Coatings – Asbestos-Free, Type III

requirements.description: Exterior dampproofing materials shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction
requirements.exact_quote: CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction

requirements.description: Exterior dampproofing materials shall conform to CAN/CSA-A123.4, Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systems
requirements.exact_quote: CAN/CSA-A123.4, Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systems

requirements.description: Alternative dampproofing materials shall have a water vapour permeance of not more than 43 ng/(Pa×s×m²) when tested in accordance with Procedure A (wet cup) of ASTM E96/E96M
requirements.exact_quote: have a water vapour permeance of not more than 43 ng/(Pa×s×m²) when tested in accordance with Procedure A (wet cup) of ASTM E96/E96M

requirements.description: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20, coved over the footing
requirements.exact_quote: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing

requirements.description: Concrete walls to be dampproofed shall have holes and recesses sealed with cement mortar or a mastic or sealant that is suitable for vertical applications and compatible with the dampproofing material
requirements.exact_quote: Concrete walls to be dampproofed shall have holes and recesses sealed with cement mortar or a mastic or sealant that is suitable for vertical applications and compatible with the dampproofing material

requirements.description: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris
requirements.exact_quote: The surface required to be dampproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the material to be applied

requirements.description: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing
requirements.exact_quote: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing

requirements.description: Dampproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, application quantity and rate, and curing times
requirements.exact_quote: dampproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, application quantity and rate, and curing times

requirements.description: Joints, cracks and penetrations shall be sealed to maintain the continuity of the dampproofing, where the dampproofing material is not capable of bridging such discontinuities
requirements.exact_quote: Joints, cracks and penetrations shall be sealed to maintain the continuity of the dampproofing, where the dampproofing material is not capable of bridging such discontinuities

requirements.description: The interior surface of foundation walls below ground level shall be protected by means that minimize the ingress of moisture from the foundation wall into interior spaces, where a separate interior finish is applied or wood members are placed in contact with such walls
requirements.exact_quote: The interior surface of foundation walls below ground level shall be protected by means that minimize the ingress of moisture from the foundation wall into interior spaces

requirements.description: Where the protection consists of membranes or coatings, the membrane or coating shall extend from the basement floor surface up to the highest extent of the interior insulation or finish, but not higher than the exterior finished ground level
requirements.exact_quote: the membrane or coating shall extend from the basement floor surface up to the highest extent of the interior insulation or finish, but not higher than the exterior finished ground level

requirements.description: No membrane or coating with a permeance less than 170 ng/(Pa×s×m²) shall be applied to the interior surface of the foundation wall above ground level between the insulation and the foundation wall
requirements.exact_quote: no membrane or coating with a permeance less than 170 ng/(Pa×s×m²) shall be applied to the interior surface of the foundation wall above ground level between the insulation and the foundation wall

requirements.description: Where dampproofing is installed between a floor-on-ground and a finished floor, it shall consist of rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly and complies with water vapour permeance requirements
requirements.exact_quote: rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(b)

requirements.description: Polyethylene dampproofing for floors-on-ground shall be not less than 0.05mm thick
requirements.exact_quote: polyethylene not less than 0.05mm thick

requirements.description: Polyethylene dampproofing joints shall be lapped not less than 100mm
requirements.exact_quote: with joints lapped not less than 100mm

requirements.description: Where hydrostatic pressure occurs, waterproofing is required for assemblies separating interior space from the ground to prevent the ingress of water into building assemblies and interior spaces
requirements.exact_quote: Where hydrostatic pressure occurs, waterproofing is required for assemblies separating interior space from the ground to prevent the ingress of water into building assemblies and interior spaces

requirements.description: Waterproofing is required for roofs of underground structures to prevent the ingress of water into building assemblies and interior spaces
requirements.exact_quote: Waterproofing is required for roofs of underground structures to prevent the ingress of water into building assemblies and interior spaces

requirements.description: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be compatible with adjoining materials and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected
requirements.exact_quote: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D1227/D1227M
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D1227/D1227M, Standard Specification for Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D3019/D3019M for lap cement with asphalt roll roofing, non-fibered and fibered (Types I and III)
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D3019/D3019M, Standard Specification for Lap Cement Used with Asphalt Roll Roofing, Non-Fibered, and Fibered

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D4479/D4479M with reinforcing material
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D4479/D4479M, Standard Specification for Asphalt Roof Coatings – Asbestos-Free, in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3) and with reinforcing material

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D4637/D4637M for EPDM sheet
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D4637/D4637M, Standard Specification for EPDM Sheet Used In Single-Ply Roof Membrane

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D4811/D4811M for nonvulcanized rubber sheet
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D4811/D4811M, Standard Specification for Nonvulcanized (Uncured) Rubber Sheet Used as Roof Flashing

requirements.description: Waterproofing materials shall conform to ASTM D6878/D6878M for TPO sheet roofing
requirements.exact_quote: ASTM D6878/D6878M, Standard Specification for Thermoplastic Polyolefin Based Sheet Roofing

requirements.description: Where a primer is required, it shall conform to CGSB 37-GP-9Ma
requirements.exact_quote: CGSB 37-GP-9Ma, Primer, Asphalt, Unfilled, for Asphalt Roofing, Dampproofing and Waterproofing, where a primer is required

requirements.description: Surfaces to be waterproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the waterproofing material manufacturer
requirements.exact_quote: Surfaces to be waterproofed shall be prepared in accordance with the instructions of the waterproofing material manufacturer

requirements.description: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on ICF walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed
requirements.exact_quote: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on ICF walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed

requirements.description: Unit masonry walls that are to be waterproofed shall be parged on exterior surfaces below ground level with not less than 6mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20, coved over the footing
requirements.exact_quote: Unit masonry walls that are to be waterproofed shall be parged on exterior surfaces below ground level with not less than 6mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing

requirements.description: Concrete walls that are to be waterproofed shall have all holes and recesses sealed with mortar or waterproofing material
requirements.exact_quote: Concrete walls that are to be waterproofed shall have all holes and recesses sealed with mortar or waterproofing material

requirements.description: Surfaces required to be waterproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris
requirements.exact_quote: Surfaces required to be waterproofed shall be clean and dry and free of ice, snow, frost, dust, dirt, oil, grease, cracks, projections and depressions, loose particles and debris that could be detrimental to the performance of the waterproofing material

requirements.description: Waterproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, required number of layers of reinforcing fabric, application quantity and rate, and curing times
requirements.exact_quote: waterproofing shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions with regard to surface priming, conditions during application, the required number of layers of reinforcing fabric on foundation, footings, floors, walls and structural slabs, application quantity and rate, and curing times

requirements.description: Waterproofing shall be continuous across joints and at junctions between different building elements
requirements.exact_quote: Waterproofing shall be continuous across joints and at junctions between different building elements

requirements.description: The waterproofed surface shall be protected with a suitable material to minimize mechanical damage during backfilling
requirements.exact_quote: The waterproofed surface shall be protected with a suitable material to minimize mechanical damage during backfilling

requirements.description: The area in which the waterproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the waterproofing system
requirements.exact_quote: The area in which the waterproofing is to be carried out shall be kept free of water during the application and curing of the waterproofing system

requirements.description: Basement floors-on-ground to be waterproofed shall have a system of membrane waterproofing provided between 2 layers of concrete, each of which shall be not less than 75mm thick
requirements.exact_quote: Basement floors-on-ground to be waterproofed shall have a system of membrane waterproofing provided between 2 layers of concrete, each of which shall be not less than 75mm thick

requirements.description: The floor membrane shall be made continuous with the wall membrane to form a complete seal
requirements.exact_quote: with the floor membrane made continuous with the wall membrane to form a complete seal

requirements.description: This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space from soil gases
requirements.exact_quote: This Subsection applies to wall, roof and floor assemblies separating conditioned space from the ground, and the rough-in to allow the future protection of conditioned space from soil gases

requirements.description: Buildings and dwelling units and buildings containing residential occupancies shall be provided with the rough-in for a radon extraction system conforming to Article 9.13.4.3
requirements.exact_quote: dwelling units and buildings containing residential occupancies shall be provided with the rough-in for a radon extraction system conforming to Article 9.13.4.3

requirements.description: Where buildings are used for occupancies other than residential, protection from radon ingress and the means to address high radon concentrations shall conform to Article 9.13.4.3 or Parts 5 and 6
requirements.exact_quote: Where buildings are used for occupancies other than those described in Sentence (2), protection from radon ingress and the means to address high radon concentrations in the future shall conform to Article 9.13.4.3, or Parts 5 and 6

articles.title: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization System

requirements.description: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of either a gas-permeable layer with an inlet and outlet, or clean granular material and a pipe
requirements.exact_quote: Floors-on-ground shall be provided with a rough-in for subfloor depressurization consisting of a gas-permeable layer, an inlet and an outlet as described in Sentence (2), or clean granular material and a pipe as described in Sentence (3)

requirements.description: The rough-in shall include a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space
requirements.exact_quote: a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space

requirements.description: An inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer shall be provided
requirements.exact_quote: an inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer

requirements.description: An outlet in the conditioned space shall permit connection to depressurization equipment, be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and be clearly labeled for radon removal
requirements.exact_quote: an outlet in the conditioned space that permits connection to depressurization equipment, is sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and is clearly labeled to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground

requirements.description: The pipe for the granular material system shall be not less than 100mm in diameter
requirements.exact_quote: a pipe not less than 100mm in diameter installed through the floor

requirements.description: The bottom end of the pipe shall open into the granular layer at or near the centre of the floor with not less than 100mm of granular material projecting beyond the terminus of the pipe
requirements.exact_quote: its bottom end opens into the granular layer required in Clause (a) at or near the centre of the floor and not less than 100mm of granular material projects beyond the terminus of the pipe measured along its axis

requirements.description: The top end of the pipe shall permit connection to depressurization equipment and be provided with an airtight cap
requirements.exact_quote: its top end permits connection to depressurization equipment and is provided with an airtight cap

requirements.description: The pipe shall be clearly labeled near the cap and every 1.8m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon
requirements.exact_quote: the pipe is clearly labeled near the cap and, if applicable, every 1.8m and at every change in direction to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon
